simpleAccount.model

Class Account

  • java.lang.Object
    • simpleAccount.model.AbstractModel
      • simpleAccount.model.Account
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Model

    public class Account
extends AbstractModel
    This is the AccountModel which is the model for the selected account which we are interacting with.
    Since:
    2015-04-05
    Author:
    Paul Bryson

      • deposit

        public void deposit(java.lang.String id,
                    java.lang.String currency,
                    java.lang.Double amount)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        The synchronized deposit() function allows users to withdraw (pass in negative value) or deposit an amount into the selected account.
        Parameters:
        id - the accountID
        currency - the type of currency selected
        amount - the amount the user wants to deposit/withdraw
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for the parsing of the ID

      • AddAmount

        public boolean AddAmount(AgentModel agent)
        The synchronized (for the agents) AddAmount() function which allows us to add to the balance of the selected account.
        Parameters:
        agent - the agent that is running
        Returns:
        boolean for if the add was successful
